thread.title: Winter storm could bring 6 inches of snow to York area over weekend
thread.title_full: Winter storm could bring 6 inches of snow to York area over weekend

author: R.J. POST York News-Times
title: Winter storm could bring 6 inches of snow to York area over weekend
text:
Top Story Editor's Pick Winter storm could bring 6 inches of snow to York area over weekend R.J. Post Jan 2, 2025 Jan 2, 2025 Updated 2 hrs ago 0 A sidewalk cleaner works on Friday in Lincoln.
KENNETH FERRIERA, Journal Star Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save R.J. Post With a significant winter storm possible this weekend, the National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a winter storm watch for York and a large portion of southeast Nebraska.
The watch will be in effect from noon Saturday through 6 p.m. Sunday.
Light freezing drizzle, snow and blowing snow could impact the area. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 6 inches and ice accumulations around a light glaze are possible.
The weather service describes the affected area as including portions of north-central Kansas and east-central and south-central Nebraska.
Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. Visibilities may drop below a half-mile due to falling and blowing snow on Saturday and Sunday.
Listen now and subscribe: Apple Podcasts | Spotify | RSS Feed | SoundStack | All Of Our Podcasts
Preceding the storm, Friday should be mostly cloudy with a high near 26 and mild winds.
People are also reading… York County Sheriff’s Office arrests driver with 0.256% blood alcohol content Nebraska inmate sues over access to son conceived with staff member Nebraska State Patrol, U.S. marshals arrest murder suspect near Goehner York’s Keagyn Linden at 15-0 grabs No. 1 spot in area boys wrestling rankings 'A magical day' — Four Corners Health Department begins using 28 remodeled rooms A 2024 York Business Beat recap 16-year-old boy dies of injuries from 'car surfing' incident in Lexington Winter storm could bring 6 inches of snow to York area over weekend Central City man died in New Year's Eve crash near Grand Island, sheriff says Nebraska man who lost his home over $588 debt is getting it back Nebraska AG fighting order for State Patrol to give information in civil lawsuit Snowblazers program keeps York kids busy during holiday break Duke girls stifle the Stars at Amherst Nebraska players relish quirks of Pinstripe Bowl in all its soaked, lawnmower-themed glory Update: Death toll hits 15; FBI says driver in truck attack likely didn't act alone But Saturday will bring a 30 percent chance of snow, mainly after noon, and a high near 20 degrees. The forecast calls for new snow accumulations of less than a half-inch in York on Saturday.
Things could really become blustery overnight Saturday with a low around 8 degrees and a 90% chance of precipitation. Patchy, blowing snow is forecast after 3 a.m.
Sunday’s forecast includes a 50 percent chance of snow, mainly before noon, and areas of blowing snow before 5 p.m. The high is predicted to be near 13, followed by an overnight low of 2 below zero.
Monday should be mostly sunny with a high near 14 degrees.
R.J. Post is a reporter for the York News-Times. Reach him at rjpost@yorknewstimes.com .
